meaning: She is the force that protects all the four divisions of the army.
commentary:
Armies of kings composed of four divisions (chaturanga) such as cavalry of elephants, horses, chariots and foot soldiers.

Mahavishnu has taken on 4 forms (chaturanga) for the sustenance of this entire creation. They are Vasudeva, Pradyumna, Aniruddha and Sankarshana. All of these are Her forms. These names were in existence long before Krishna’s period.

Similarly, the Supreme Brahma has split into 4 aspects for the transmission of Jnana to the beings viz. Veda-purusha, Chandha-purusha, Shareera-purusha and Maha-purusha.

Further mantra upasana has 4 classifications- Pada (akshara or alphabets), beeja (seed leeters or beejakshara), sankhyaa and rekha (yantra).

As She is the force behind all these various factors, She is Chaturanga baleshwari.
